document.forum_title: Latest business and finance news from New Zealand and the world's key markets - Yahoo New Zealand Finance
document.discussion_title: $A falls on rising US rate hike view
document.topic_text: 01 $A falls on rising US rate hike view AAP – 32 minutes ago Print The Australian dollar has fallen against its US counterpart, amid mounting market expectations of a rate hike in the US following some encouraging comments by the US Federal Reserve. At 1700 AEST on Monday, the local unit was trading at 75.97 US cents, down from 76.44 cents on Friday. US Federal Reserve vice chairman Stanley Fischer flagged on Sunday that a 2016 rate hike is possible, noting the US economy is close to meeting the central bank's goals and that growth will gain steam. Mr Fischer's comments, plus the board's minutes meeting last week, suggest that we are "probably closer" to a potential rate hike at some point later this year, Westpac chief currency strategist Robert Rennie said on Monday. Westpac continues to forecast a US rate hike in December, Mr Rennie said. Investors will be closely watching US Federal Reserve chair Janet Yellen's comments at the annual Jackson Hole economic symposium, to be held in Wyoming on Friday, he said. Ratings agency Moody's decision last Friday to cut its rating outlook on Australia's major banks to negative from stable also continues to weigh on the Aussie. CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 1700 AEST ON MONDAY One Australian dollar buys: * 75.97 US cents, from 76.44 cents on Friday * 76.54 Japanese yen, from 76.52 yen * 67.32 euro cents, from 67.39 euro cents * 105.01 New Zealand cents, from 105.00 NZ cents * 58.19 British pence, from 58.12 pence GOLD: * The spot price of gold in Sydney at 1700 AEST was $US1,333.25 per fine ounce, up $US15.55 on Friday's price of $US1,348.80. GOVERNMENT BOND YIELDS AT 1630 AEST ON MONDAY: * CGS 5.25pct March 2019, 1.4204, from 1.3887pct on Friday * CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 1.9015pct, from 1.8615pct Sydney Futures Exchange prices: * September 2016 10-year bond futures contract was at 98.08 (implying a yield 1.92 per cent), down from 98.125 (1.875 per cent) on Friday. * September 2016 3-year bond futures contract at 98.60 (1.40 per cent), down slightly from 98.63 (1.37 per cent). (*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session, bond market closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session)
